summary: The Rural Broadband Assistance Act aims to expand broadband service access in rural communities. It amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to allow the Secretary to provide grants to organizations offering technical assistance and training to eligible entities. This assistance will focus on areas such as preparing grant applications, identifying funding sources, conducting feasibility studies, and analyzing broadband facility management. Eligible entities include tribal entities, state and local governments, educational institutions, and nonprofits. Priority will be given to organizations with experience in rural technical assistance.
